business.headline: Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

No penalty for missed income tax deadlines? Panel suggests in New Tax BillThe suggestions come from the Select Committee, which has studied the new Income Tax Bill, 2025. This new Bill is meant to replace the old Income Tax Act of 1961.

ED conducts raids on properties linked to Anil Ambani in MumbaiThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday carried out searches at multiple locations in Mumbai connected to industrialist Anil Ambani's companies, days after the State Bank of India (SBI) classified Reliance Communications and Ambani himself as 'fraud'. While his personal residence wasn't searched, ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai targeted premises tied to Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies in connection with an ongoing money laundering investigation.

IEX share price crashes 23% to hit 52-week low. What's behind the fall?IEX shares nosedived after CERC announced phased implementation of market coupling. The move aims to centralise price discovery, challenging IEX's dominance. Investors await clarity from the company's Q1FY26 results.

ED raids Anil Ambani-linked premises in Mumbai days after SBI's 'fraud' tagWhile Anil Ambani's personal residence was not part of the search operation, the ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai visited premises tied to some of his group companies.

NSDL IPO: Check key dates, issue size and other key detailsThe NSDL IPO will open on July 30 and close on August 1, offering 5.01 crore shares through an offer for sale by existing institutional shareholders.

entertainment.headline: Huma Qureshi's Bayaan to premiere at TIFF 2025 as only Indian filmActor Huma Qureshi's film 'Bayaan' will have its world premiere at TIFF 2025. The film directed by Bikas Ranjan Mishra has been selected for the prestigious global festival's Discovery section.

DJ Snake returns to India with a six-city tour: I've missed your energyDJ Snake is set to return to India with a six-city tour in September. He will kick off his tour in Kolkata on September 26 and wrap it up in Delhi-NCR on October 5.

No retakes, no scripts: The Traitors India director on filming show real-time'The Traitors India' director Nishant Nayak shared insights on directing the reality TV show with no retakes and live filming. In an interview with India Today, he highlighted how authenticity and Indian sensibilities shaped the unique adaptation.

Taylor Swift's Eras Tour looks turned into 13 wax statues at Madame TussaudsMadame Tussauds has unveiled 13 new wax figures of Taylor Swift, capturing her iconic looks from the record-breaking Eras Tour across 13 cities worldwide. This historic release celebrates Swift's immense influence in music and fashion, offering fans a unique experience of her legendary style.

Aneet Padda avoids paparazzi, selfies with fans amid Saiyaara success. WatchActor Aneet Padda recently avoided paparazzi and selfies with fans. She preferred to stay low profile amid the success of her latest film, 'Saiyaara'.

Tamannaah Bhatia dazzles in Rahul Mishra's Sufi-inspired couture collectionActor Tamannaah Bhatia walked the ramp for designer Rahul Mishraat at the Hyundai India Couture Week 2025 in New Delhi on Wednesday. She unveiled the 'Becoming Love' collection with two stunning outfits.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 1 prediction: Pawan Kalyan's biggest opener yet'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' is looking at surpassing the opening-day figures of Pawan Kalyan's 'Vakeel Saab' to become the biggest opener of his career. The film has recorded tremendous traction in advance sales.

Janhvi Kapoor reacts to man kicking clinic receptionist: Nothing excuses thisActor Janhvi Kapoor recently reacted to the viral incident where a man allegedly kicked and dragged a clinic receptionist. The actor questioned such sort of upbringing and demanded strict punishment.

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's $100 million Netflix deal to end without renewalPrince Harry and Meghan Markle's Netflix deal will end this year without renewal. The partnership, valued at approximately $100 million, has now reportedly "run its course". The deal was signed in 2020.

Uorfi Javed's swollen face heals, attends Delhi event after lip filler removalJust a day after revealing the swelling caused by dissolving her lip fillers, Uorfi Javed made a confident public appearance at India Couture Week in Delhi, looking completely normal. The actor-influencer recently got her lip fillers dissolved.

Exclusive: Don 3 makers to recreate 'Aaj Ki Raat' style track with Kriti Sanon 'Don 3', the highly anticipated Bollywood reboot, will star Ranveer Singh and Kriti Sanon in lead roles. The makers are planning a special dance track, similar to 'Aaj Ki Raat'.

Saiyaara box office Day 6: Mohit Suri's film's remarkable run crosses Rs 150 crore'Saiyaara' has been making the perfect noise from Bollywood in theatres. The love story has been on a record-breaking spree, and there seems no stopping its extraordinary run - at least in the next 10 days.

Aye aye captain, says Priyanka Chopra as daughter Malti steers yacht. See picActor Priyanka Chopra Jonas shared a cute photo of her daughter Malti and mother-in-law Denise Jonas on social media. She is currently on a holiday with her family.

Hans Zimmer joins Euphoria Season 3 as composer, Labrinth returnsLegendary music composer and producer Hans Zimmer has teamed up with English singer and songwriter Labrinth for 'Euphoria Season 3' music score. The upcoming season will release in 2026.

Bigg Boss 19 to feature AI influencer Kavya Mehra as first digital contestant: ReportAI influencer Kavya Mehra may join the much-awaited 19th season of reality TV show Bigg Boss. She would be the first digital contestant in the show's history.

Kalki Koechlin says her parents' divorce shaped her own with Anurag KashyapKalki Koechlin opened up about how her parents' divorce shaped her perspective on relationships, including her own separation from Anurag Kashyap. The two married in 2011 and officially parted ways in 2015.

Kamal Haasan reviews Fahadh Faasil-Vadivelu's Maareesan: Dances between wit, depthKamal Haasan appreciated the wit and depth of 'Maareesan', a Tamil comedy thriller by Sudheesh Sankar, set to release on 25 July 2025. The film features Fahadh Faasil and Vadivelu in lead roles.

Benedict Cumberbatch labels Hollywood as grossly wasteful, urges sustainabilityActor Benedict Cumberbatch recently criticised Hollywood as grossly wasteful in a food-focused podcast. He highlighted excessive resource consumption in filmmaking and advocated for increased sustainability.

Thalapathy Vijay's son Jason Sanjay shoots for debut directorial in Salem. WatchThalapathy Vijay's son, Jason Sanjay, is currently shooting for his maiden directorial venture. The shooting of the film is currently progressing at a brisk pace in Tamil Nadu's Salem.

general news.headline: Live: PM Modi meets British counterpart Keir Starmer in London during visit to UKPrime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in London to a warm welcome from the Indian diaspora, ahead of the signing of a landmark Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with the United Kingdom-one of the key highlights of his visit. During his brief but packed schedule before departing for the Maldives, PM Modi is set to hold wide-ranging talks with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer at Chequers and meet King Charles III. The FTA and his audience with the monarch are being seen as the centrepiece of the visit, which also aims to boost the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. This marks PM's fourth visit to the UK since taking office, following previous trips in 2015, 2018, and 2021.

Did High Court apply its mind? Supreme Court fumes over bail to actor DarshanThe Supreme Court reserved its order on the Karnataka government's plea challenging bail to actor Darshan in the Renukaswamy murder case. The bench called the High Court's bail order a perverse exercise of discretion.

Russian plane crashes killing all 49 aboard, pilot error during landing suspectedA Russian passenger plane operated by Angara airline crashed near Tynda in the Far East on Monday, killing all 49 on board -- including five children -- after losing contact with air traffic control during a second landing attempt in poor visibility, with pilot error or technical malfunction suspected.

Rishabh Pant suffers right toe fracture, likely out of England seriesRishabh Pant is unlikely to take any further part in the Manchester Test and is expected to miss the remainder of the ongoing Test series against England after scans revealed a fracture in his right toe.

F-16 jets, rocket strikes: Why 'friends' Thailand and Cambodia are at warThe Thailand-Cambodia border region has become the site of a deadly clash between the two Southeast Asian neighbours over a simmering territorial dispute, leaving over 10 civilians and soldiers dead.

Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.

Mumbai blasts: Top court halts acquittal order, but accused won't be re-arrestedThe Supreme Court said the Bombay High Court judgment, acquitting all the accused in the 7/11 Mumbai blasts case, shall not be treated as a precedent.

How India's strategic assets lie exposed, vulnerable to harmWith detailed imagery of military bases, nuclear plants, border posts and more easily accessible to Open Source Intelligence, how dangerous is this for national security?

Jain & the art of diplomatic immunityIt was nothing short of a diplomatic Disneyland. The UP STF busted Harsh Vardhan Jain, "Baron" of Westarctica, who turned a rented Ghaziabad bungalow into a fake embassy for imaginary nations. With forged passports, luxury cars bearing diplomatic plates, and photos with real leaders, he scammed job-seekers and firms.

Bengaluru stampede: RCB, cops to face action as Karnataka approves probe reportThe Karnataka cabinet has approved the Justice Cunha report on the June 4 stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium that killed 11. Action will be taken against RCB, KSCA, DNA, and police officials. The report cites gross negligence.

Why Indian graduates are struggling to find jobsIndia faces a growing employability crisis as many graduates lack necessary job skills. This gap threatens youth employment and calls for urgent educational reforms.

Live: Both Houses adjourned amid sloganeering by Opposition against Bihar voter revisionParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: Today marks the fourth day of the Monsoon Session of Parliament, which is expected to remain as stormy as the past three days, with the Opposition demanding a discussion on the revision of the Bihar voters' list, among other issues. The Readjustment of Representation of Scheduled Tribes in Assembly Constituencies of the State of Goa Bill and the Merchant Shipping Bill are scheduled to be discussed and passed in Parliament today. The debate over the sudden exit of the Vice President is also expected to continue. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for real-time updates from both Houses of Parliament.

No more tech hiring in India, Donald Trump tells Google and MicrosoftUS President Donald Trump has sent a strong message to big tech companies like Google and Microsoft, asking them to stop hiring overseas, including in countries like India.

Dugga Dugga: BJP, Trinamool battle for Bengal's presiding deity DurgaWith West Bengal headed for the crucial Assembly election in 2026, goddess Durga, the presiding deity of the state, has taken centre stage in the political battlefield. From PM Modi's rally chant to CM Mamata Banerjee's proposed 'Durga Angan', both BJP and TMC are invoking the deity in a bid to sway voters.
Dates vs bananas: Which is the smarter snacking option?Bananas and dates have often been pitted against each other when it comes to choosing the healthier option.

Photo alongside PM, Mercedes fleet: Jagdeep Dhankhar's demands widened riftJagdeep Dhankhar's tussle with the government was not a one-day affair and had been brewing for long over a list of demands by the former Vice President.

Foreign tourist picks up trash at Himachal waterfall, video sparks civic sense debateIn a video filmed at a scenic waterfall in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra, a foreign tourist is seen collecting plastic wrappers and other garbage left behind by visitors and throwing them into a dustbin.

sports.headline: 4th Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Jadeja, Shardul look to buildIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Ravindra Jadeja and Shardul Thakur are in the middle with India looking to go past the 300-run mark in the morning session. The hosts, on the other hand, would be looking for early wickets.

Should Rishabh Pant be allowed a batting sub? Parthiv Patel weighsENG vs IND: Speaking to Rishabh Pant's toe injury, Parthiv Patel said that he's okay with the ICC's rule of like-for-like replacement of wicketkeepers where the incoming player won't be allowed to bat and will only be allowed to keep wickets.

Not everything goes as you thought: Rashford on United amid Barcelona moveMarcus Rashford accepted that Manchester United were going through changes and it did not include him in his plans. Despite this he did not badmouth the club whilst being unveiled as a new FC Barcelona player.

Stuart Broad backs Rishabh Pant to bat with 'bruised foot' in ManchesterENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant suffered a foot injury on Day 1 of the fourth Test at the Old Trafford in Manchester after being struck by a yorker from Chris Woakes.

Zahaan Hemrajani secures historic top 10 finish at U17 sailing worldsMumbai's Zahaan Hemrajani secured a top 10 overall finish at the prestigious U17 O'pen Skiff World Championships, held from July 17 to 23 in Nishinomiya, Japan. His result marks one of the highest-ever finishes by an Indian sailor at this global youth event.

China Open: Satwik-Chirag reach quarterfinals, HS Prannoy crashes outSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty advanced to the quarterfinals of the China Open with a commanding win over Indonesia's top doubles pair. However, India's singles campaign came to an end as HS Prannoy bowed out after a hard-fought three-game loss.

Ravindra Jadeja aims for Gary Sobers' historic Test double in EnglandENG vs IND: Ravindra Jadeja is on the cusp of reaching the unique double of 1000 runs and 30 wickets in Tests on English soil. Gary Sobers is the only visiting cricketer to have achieved the feat.

Dinesh Karthik questions India's call to send Shardul ahead of SundarFormer India batter Dinesh Karthik has questioned the Indian team management to promote Shardul Thakur ahead of Washington Sundar after Rishabh Pant retired hurt in the fourth Test against England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
